description:
The URD segment is used in sending unsolicited updates about orders and results. Its purpose is similar to that of the QRD segment, but from the results/unsolicited update point of view. Some of the fields have parallels in the QRD segment.

This segment is retained for backward compatibility only as of V2.4.

1.name: R/U Date/Time
1.description: This field contains the date and time the update was generated by the application program.

2.name: Report Priority
2.description: This field contains the priority associated with this report or update. Refer to HL7 Table 0109 - Report priority for valid values.
2.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

3.name: R/U Who Subject Definition
3.description: This field contains the definition of the subject, or who the report is about.
3.data_type: XCN - Extended Composite ID Number and Name for Persons

4.name: R/U What Subject Definition
4.description: This field describes the kind of information that is provided in the report. Valid values are the type of transaction inquiry. Refer to HL7 Table 0048 - What subject filter for valid values.

5.name: R/U What Department Code
5.description: This field contains either a test number, procedure number, drug code, item number, order number, etc., to identify the department. The contents of this field are determined by the contents of the previous field. This field could contain multiple occurrences separated by repetition delimiters.

6.name: R/U Display/Print Locations
6.description: This field contains a list of the locations to which the report should be distributed.

7.name: R/U Results Level
7.description: This field is used to control level of detail in results. Refer to HL7 Table 0108 - Query results level for valid values. Default level is T for full results. See Chapters 4 and 7.
7.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables
